alert.note: Alert for Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 6:50PM EDT until May 08 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western Maryland, including the following county: Garrett. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 649 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mountain Lake Park... Oakland... Bittinger... Grantsville... Loch Lynn Heights... Friendsville... Deer Park... Accident... Deep Creek Lake State Park... McHenry... McComas Beach... Swallow Falls State Park... Big Run State Park... Selbysport... Jennings... Keysers Ridge... Mineral Spring... New Germany... Hutton... Crellin... - Please visit https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety information.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
